page.title: 06CHURCH: BUILDING AND WARDENS
page.content: The church is in the north west part of Marcham. In the tower of the church there is a belfry.The belfry is medieval. The medieval belfry is one of the very few in the country. The main part of the church was rebuilt in 1837 by Thomas Duffield, the MP for Abingdon. The vicar in Marcham lives in the vicarage. The old vicarage was called Netherfield House which was built in 1850 in Church Street. The vicar and the church wardens are trustees of the Anson Trust. This was started in memory of Arthur Anson in 1913 to benefit the village. The Village Institute (St Nicholas) is part of the trust.
